intro: Rytigynia bagshawei var. bagshawei, commonly known as the Chinese mountain ash, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rutaceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers that appear in clusters. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically red or orange when mature. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in forested areas. The leaves are simple, alternate, and have a slightly serrated edge, contributing to its ornamental value.
